content: Emotional intelligence can make a significant difference in how individuals handle and cope with stress. While it is possible for someone to tough it out and handle stress regardless of their emotional intelligence level, individuals with higher emotional intelligence tend to have more effective coping mechanisms and are better able to adapt to unexpected situations. They are also more likely to have stronger social support networks and better communication skills, which can help them manage and navigate difficult situations with greater ease. Additionally, research has shown that individuals with higher emotional intelligence may have better physical and mental health outcomes, including lower levels of stress and anxiety, improved immune function, and better overall well-being.
